%D1: "We admire your glorious capital"
[ICON_BULLET]Farms in City Proximity (Fat Cross) Give an Additional [ICON_FOOD] Per %d1 Adjacent Farms Before the Discovery Of Biology
[ICON_BULLET]%s1%F2 from Unique Power
After years of following the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_CivicName[COLOR_REVERT] civic, a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s2_UnitName[COLOR_REVERT] has been born
[ICON_BULLET]Can Sacrifice this Unit in a City with Sacrificial Altar for %D1_Change[ICON_CULTURE] per Era, %D2_Change[ICON_GOLD] and Temporary Happiness in the City (Does Not Stack).
Sacrifice Slave
This order will sacrifice the Slave in the city they are currently in. It kills the Slave.
A Slave was sacrificed in %s1_city.
Double Eureka boost for ancient and classical technologies. After entering the Classical Era: -10% [ICON_RESEARCH].
+6[ICON_PRODUCTION] for sacrificing population with slavery. Gain slavery points for sacrificing population.
1 commerce of each type in capital per population over 5. No unhappiness in capital.

Coastal trade routes +100%[ICON_COMMERCE]. All government civics are enabled from the start. After playing with one government civic for 30 consequtive turns (on normal speed), gain a great person. Applies once per civic. Tyrrany -> Great Engineer, Autocracy -> Great General, City States -> Great Merchant, Dynasticism -> Great Artist, Theocracy -> Great Prophet, Republic -> Great Scientist.
Killing a land unit and advancing to its plot gives an Aztec Slave while playing Slavery.
+2[ICON_FOOD] from farm improved food resources like Rice, Wheat, Corn. 75% unhealthiness from population.

Farms are always irrigated even without fresh water and can be build without fresh water. Can remove Forest/Jungle from the start. Cities always have access to fresh water and get maximum bonus yields if founded on an accessible resource.

Double health bonus from access to fresh water. After entering the Medieval Era: Cities with state religion receive 1[ICON_GOLD] per population over 6. Can assign unlimited Priests in cities with a state religion temple. Priests +1[ICON_GOLD].
Can hurry military units with population. Great Military Instructors grant 2 additional experience to trained units.

After entering the Classical Era: Can trade with every known capital as long as not being at war with that player. Those traderoutes give +200%[ICON_COMMERCE]. Costs for hiring mercenaries are at 50%.

Cities on the same continent have +50% production bonus towards classical or earlier buildings that already exist in capital. After entering the Classical Era: When conquering a city of a civilization that has not yet entered the medieval era, receive (cities culture level+1) military land units of that conquered civilization.

Iron is revealed at the start of the game. +2[ICON_COMMERCE] from Mines improving resources. Cities gain +0.25[ICON_CULTURE] per unimproved Forest in their territory. Melee units can pillage without losing movement points. Double [ICON_GOLD] bonus from conquering enemy cities.

After entering the Classical Era: Merchants +1[ICON_FOOD], Oasis +2[ICON_FOOD]. Building a Mine on a desert hill instantly discovers Gold if there is no adjacent Gold resource already. Double chance of discovering Gold with Mine improvements.

Unlocks unique [LINK=literal]Terrace[\LINK] improvement after discovery of Construction. Peak tiles can be worked with base yields 3[ICON_PRODUCTION]1[ICON_COMMERCE] and +1[ICON_FOOD] if adjacent to Terrace.

After the discovery of Exclusivism: 50% higher income of state religion Shrines. Gain +20% strength for attacking cities of players with a different state religion (not secular states). State religion spreads to conquered cities and temples and monasteries are build automatically on conquest.

After entering the Medieval Era: Colonies with state religion pay 50% distance maintenance. +100% settler production for cities with state religion. After the discovery of Gundpowder: Gain a Conquistador when spreading state religion to a colony.

After the discovery of Gunpowder: Cities do not revolt when captured. Can conscript units without Conscription Civic in cities with less than 10% own culture. No unhappiness from conscripting units and conscripted units start with experience.
Can build Windmills on coastal land. After the discovery of Corporation: Gain an additional resource from plantations. Trade routes contribute to Great Merchant birth (20% of trade income).

Other civilizations have +2 Attitude when Byzantine capital is more cultural advanced. After entering the Medieval Era: +2[ICON_ESPIONAGE] from state religion buildings, naval units can train Greek Fire Promotion.

Gain double Great General points from naval combat. After entering the Renaissance Era: Whenever a hidden nationality unit kills another unit, gain gold equal to the production cost of the killed unit. +400%[ICON_COMMERCE] trade route income from oversea vassals.

After entering the Industrial Era: Trade routes contribute to Great People birth (40% of trade income). Trade routes with other players cities who have one or more corporations owned by America are at +600%[ICON_COMMERCE]. Double production for Corporation Executives.

After entering the Industrial Era: +1[ICON_PRODUCTION] from Mines. Can sacrifice a Great General to start a mini golden age that is 67% as long as a regular golden age. Does not require sacrificing other great persons and does not advance golden age requirements.

Foreign city culture spread to Japanese tiles is reduced by 75%. Harbors give additional +1[ICON_HEALTHY] from Clam, Crab and Fish. After entering the Industrial Era: +40%[ICON_RESEARCH] for techs that have been discovered by someone else.
Golden Ages last 40% longer. Land units have one additional movement during a Golden Age.
Units can heal by pillaging enemy tiles. After entering the Medieval Era: Enemy cities with less than Influential culture start revolting when a defender is killed by Mongols.
Starts with Eureka boost for Polytheism. +50% Great People birth for each Religion in a city. Actively spreading a religion never drives out existing religion of a city.
Land tiles adjacent to Peaks have +1[ICON_COMMERCE]. Cities founded on hills have +1[ICON_FOOD].
Ships with hidden nationality can pillage adjacent land tiles. Tundra tiles +1[ICON_COMMERCE]. Free Amphibious promotion for melee units.
Coastal Raid
Order the unit to pillage the selected land tile (counts as attack)
Coastal Raid
This order will pillage the improvement of target land tile (counts as attack).

After entering the Medieval Era: +100%[ICON_COMMERCE] from oversea trade routes. Trade missions grant 50% more [ICON_GOLD] for each instance of a happiness resource in trading city's fatcross that Portugal does not have access to without import trading.

After entering the Industrial Era: Towns provide +1[ICON_COMMERCE] for each three adjacent Towns. Great works give additional [ICON_GOLD] if target city has access to Hit Singles or Hit Movies (insufficient resources decrease [ICON_GOLD] bonus).

After entering the Medieval Era: Additional progress to Great Spy (+6[ICON_GREATPEOPLE]) in cities with a Fort in City radius. Double Anarchy length. If Pope has good relations (pleased or friendly) to Holy Romans: Double vote count in Apostolic Palace and +50% unit production in cities with Apostolic Palace religion if it is also state religion.

After entering the Medieval Era: No resource shortage malus in capital. State religion Cathedrals give additional progress to Great Engineers (+6[ICON_GREATPEOPLE]). Great People in Capital provide +3[ICON_GOLD].

After entering the Medieval Era: Tundra tiles +1[ICON_PRODUCTION]. On their home continent: 10% combat bonus for all units inside own borders, +100% yields for improvements on strategic resources, +1[ICON_COMMERCE] for Workshops adjacent to strategic resources.

Founding a city next to a lake: -25% distance maintenance in all cities. Founding a city on Tundra: Fishing Boats +1[ICON_FOOD]. Founding a city on Desert: Artists +1[ICON_CULTURE]. Founding a city on Deer, Horses or Ivory: Land units gain 50% more experience points from combat. Founding a city on Forest: Can construct Totem Pole in all cities. Founding a city on Jungle: +5% defense in all cities.
Unique Power unlocked: -25% distance maintenance in all cities.
Unique Power unlocked: Fishing Boats +1[ICON_FOOD].
Unique Power unlocked: Artists +1[ICON_CULTURE].
Unique Power unlocked: Land units gain 50% more experience points from combat
Unique Power unlocked: Can construct Totem Pole.
Unique Power unlocked: +5% defense in all cities.
You captured %d1_Num[ICON_GOLD] from destroying a %s2_UnitName!
